quizzes.title: COLREG - Collision Avoidance Rules
quizzes.description: Basic questions about maritime collision avoidance rules

questions.question: What color is the starboard sidelight?
questions.explanation: According to COLREG Rule 23, the starboard sidelight must be green.

questions.question: What is the maximum horizontal range of a masthead light?
questions.explanation: For vessels up to 50m, the masthead light range is typically 5 nautical miles.

questions.question: At what angle does an all-round light shine?
questions.explanation: An all-round light shines in all directions - 360 degrees.

questions.question: What does a power-driven vessel display when underway?
questions.explanation: A power-driven vessel underway displays a masthead light, sidelights (red and green), and a sternlight.

questions.question: Which color is the port sidelight?
questions.explanation: According to COLREG Rule 23, the port sidelight must be red.

questions.question: A vessel not under command displays how many red all-round lights?
questions.explanation: A vessel not under command displays two red all-round lights in a vertical line.

questions.question: What does the sternlight show?
questions.explanation: The sternlight shows abaft the beam - 135 degrees (112.5 degrees on each side of the stern).

questions.question: At anchor, a vessel displays which lights?
questions.explanation: A vessel at anchor displays one all-round white light (for vessels under 50m) at the best visible position.

questions.question: A fishing vessel trawling displays lights in what pattern?
questions.explanation: A fishing vessel engaged in trawling displays green all-round light above a white all-round light in vertical line.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the BOW arrow indicator?
options: Indicate the vessel's heading and bow position
questions.explanation: The BOW arrow shows the front (bow) of the vessel and indicates its heading direction.

quizzes.title: STCW - Training & Certification Standards
quizzes.description: Questions about STCW Convention requirements for seafarers

questions.question: What does STCW stand for?
options: Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping
Safety Training for Crew and Watchmen
Standards of Technical Certification for Watchkeeping
questions.explanation: STCW stands for Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers.

questions.question: What is the minimum rest period required in any 24-hour period?
questions.explanation: STCW requires minimum 10 hours of rest in any 24-hour period.

questions.question: How often must Basic Safety Training be refreshed?
questions.explanation: Basic Safety Training certificates are valid for 5 years and must be refreshed.

questions.question: What is the maximum work hours in any seven-day period?
questions.explanation: STCW limits work hours to maximum 72 hours in any seven-day period.

questions.question: Which certificate is required for all seafarers?
questions.explanation: Basic Safety Training (BST) is mandatory for all seafarers under STCW.

questions.question: What is the minimum age for an Officer in Charge of a Watch (OICNW)?
questions.explanation: The minimum age for OICNW qualification is 18 years according to STCW.

questions.question: How many elements are in Basic Safety Training?
questions.explanation: BST consists of four elements: Personal Survival Techniques, Fire Prevention and Fire Fighting, Elementary First Aid, and Personal Safety and Social Responsibilities.

questions.question: What is the minimum period of seagoing service for Master certification?
questions.explanation: A minimum of 36 months (3 years) seagoing service is typically required for Master certification under STCW.

questions.question: Which chapter of STCW covers radio operators?
questions.explanation: Chapter IV of STCW Convention covers standards for radio operators and GMDSS requirements.

questions.question: What must be recorded in the seafarer's Record of Rest Hours?
questions.explanation: The Record of Rest Hours must document both work and rest periods to ensure STCW compliance.

questions.question: What is the validity period of a Medical Fitness Certificate?
questions.explanation: Medical Fitness Certificates are typically valid for 2 years, though for seafarers over 18 years may be shorter.

questions.question: Which STCW chapter covers standards for Masters and Deck Officers?
questions.explanation: Chapter II of STCW covers standards of competence for Masters and Deck Department officers.

questions.question: What does GMDSS stand for?
options: Global Maritime Distress and Safety System
General Maritime Defense and Safety System
questions.explanation: GMDSS stands for Global Maritime Distress and Safety System.

questions.question: How long can rest hours be divided into at most?
options: Two periods, one at least 6 hours
questions.explanation: Rest hours may be divided into no more than two periods, one of which must be at least 6 hours in length.

questions.question: What is the minimum seagoing service required for Chief Mate?
questions.explanation: Chief Mate typically requires 24 months of seagoing service as an officer in charge of a navigational watch.

questions.question: Which certificate allows operation of survival craft and rescue boats?
options: PSCRB (Proficiency in Survival Craft and Rescue Boats)
questions.explanation: PSCRB certificate is required to take charge of survival craft and rescue boats.

questions.question: What does ISM Code stand for?
questions.explanation: ISM stands for International Safety Management Code.

questions.question: How often must Emergency Drills be conducted on board?
questions.explanation: Emergency drills (fire and abandon ship) must be conducted at least monthly according to SOLAS/STCW.

questions.question: What is the minimum qualification for Engine Room Watch?
options: OICEW (Officer in Charge of Engineering Watch)
Rating forming part of engineering watch
questions.explanation: Ratings forming part of an engineering watch must meet STCW Chapter III standards.

questions.question: Which chapter covers standards for Engine Officers?
questions.explanation: Chapter III of STCW covers standards of competence for Engine Department officers.

questions.question: What is the purpose of STCW Section A-VIII/1?
questions.explanation: Section A-VIII/1 specifies fitness for duty and watchkeeping arrangements.

questions.question: How many types of tankers require specialized training under STCW?
questions.explanation: STCW requires specialized training for oil tankers, chemical tankers, and liquefied gas tankers.

questions.question: What is Bridge Resource Management (BRM)?
options: Effective use of all available bridge resources
questions.explanation: BRM is the effective use and coordination of all available resources on the bridge, including personnel, equipment, and information.

questions.question: What does ECDIS stand for?
options: Electronic Chart Display and Information System
Electronic Communication and Data Integration System
questions.explanation: ECDIS stands for Electronic Chart Display and Information System.

questions.question: What is the minimum rest period between work periods?
questions.explanation: The interval between consecutive rest periods must not exceed 14 hours, and minimum 6 hours rest in one period is required.

questions.question: Which STCW chapter covers Ship Security Officers?
questions.explanation: Chapter VI of STCW covers emergency, occupational safety, security, medical care and survival functions.

questions.question: What does MLC stand for in maritime context?
questions.explanation: MLC stands for Maritime Labour Convention, which complements STCW requirements.

questions.question: How often must fire fighting drills include starting of fire pumps?
questions.explanation: Every fire drill must include the starting of a fire pump using at least two required jets of water.

questions.question: What is ARPA?
questions.explanation: ARPA stands for Automatic Radar Plotting Aid, used for collision avoidance.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Manila Amendments 2010?
questions.explanation: The Manila Amendments 2010 comprehensively revised the STCW Convention, introducing new requirements and updating existing standards.

questions.question: Which competency table covers OICNW (Officer in Charge of Navigational Watch)?
questions.explanation: Table A-II/1 in STCW Code specifies the minimum standard of competence for OICNW.

questions.question: What is required for revalidation of certificates?
questions.explanation: Certificate revalidation requires evidence of seagoing service and/or completion of approved refresher training.

questions.question: What does COP mean in STCW context?
questions.explanation: COP stands for Certificate of Proficiency, issued for specific competencies.

questions.question: What is Crowd Management training required for?
questions.explanation: Crowd Management training is specifically required for personnel serving on passenger ships.

questions.question: How long is the validity of Security Awareness training?
questions.explanation: Security Awareness training certificates do not expire once obtained, though some companies may require refresher training.

questions.question: What is ERM in maritime context?
questions.explanation: ERM stands for Engine Resource Management, similar to BRM but for the engine room.

questions.question: Which function includes Medical First Aid training?
options: Controlling operation of ship and care for persons on board
questions.explanation: Medical First Aid is part of the function 'Controlling operation of the ship and care for persons on board'.

questions.question: What is the minimum manning requirement based on?
options: Safe manning document issued by flag state
questions.explanation: The Safe Manning Document, issued by the flag state, specifies the minimum crew required for safe operation.

questions.question: What does CoC stand for?
questions.explanation: CoC stands for Certificate of Competency, the main qualification certificate for officers.

questions.question: Which training is NOT part of Basic Safety Training?
questions.explanation: Advanced Fire Fighting is a separate advanced training, not part of Basic Safety Training (BST).
